intro: Crypsinus integerrimus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in humid, warm environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. The flowers, which come in a variety of colors, bloom throughout the year under proper care.
